title: Give me a synopsis of the latest NVIDIA enterprise /datacenter GPU roadmap

parts: Give me a synopsis of the latest NVIDIA enterprise /datacenter GPU roadmap

## NVIDIA enterprise / datacenter GPU roadmap (publicly disclosed as of **Feb 26, 2026**)

### 1) **Hopper (shipping generation)**
- **H100** (and derivatives) are the prior/current baseline widely deployed in AI/HPC data centers (2023-era generation), and are the reference point NVIDIA uses for most “X× vs Hopper” claims. ([investor.nvidia.com](https://investor.nvidia.com/news/press-release-details/2025/NVIDIA-Blackwell-Ultra-AI-Factory-Platform-Paves-Way-for-Age-of-AI-Reasoning/default.aspx?utm_source=openai))

### 2) **Blackwell (current platform wave) — 2024 → 2025 ramp**
- **Blackwell GPUs (B200-class)** and systems:
  - **GB200 Grace Blackwell Superchip** (2× Blackwell GPUs + 1× Grace CPU over NVLink-C2C) ([investor.nvidia.com](https://investor.nvidia.com/news/press-release-details/2024/NVIDIA-Blackwell-Platform-Arrives-to-Power-a-New-Era-of-Computing/default.aspx?utm_source=openai))  
  - **HGX B200** (8-GPU server board for enterprise/OEM servers) ([investor.nvidia.com](https://investor.nvidia.com/news/press-release-details/2024/NVIDIA-Blackwell-Platform-Arrives-to-Power-a-New-Era-of-Computing/default.aspx?utm_source=openai))  
  - **GB200 NVL72** rack-scale system (72 GPUs + 36 Grace CPUs interconnected with NVLink) ([investor.nvidia.com](https://investor.nvidia.com/news/press-release-details/2024/NVIDIA-Blackwell-Platform-Arrives-to-Power-a-New-Era-of-Computing/default.aspx?utm_source=openai))  
- NVIDIA positioned Blackwell partner availability to begin **later in 2024** (per the original Blackwell launch messaging). ([investor.nvidia.com](https://investor.nvidia.com/news/press-release-details/2024/NVIDIA-Blackwell-Platform-Arrives-to-Power-a-New-Era-of-Computing/default.aspx?utm_source=openai))

### 3) **Blackwell Ultra (B300 / GB300) — “reasoning” refresh in 2H 2025**
- Products in this step include:
  - **GB300 NVL72** rack-scale solution
  - **HGX B300 NVL16** (enterprise/OEM form factor) ([investor.nvidia.com](https://investor.nvidia.com/news/press-release-details/2025/NVIDIA-Blackwell-Ultra-AI-Factory-Platform-Paves-Way-for-Age-of-AI-Reasoning/default.aspx?utm_source=openai))
- NVIDIA’s stated timing: **Blackwell Ultra-based products are expected from partners starting in the second half of 2025**. ([investor.nvidia.com](https://investor.nvidia.com/news/press-release-details/2025/NVIDIA-Blackwell-Ultra-AI-Factory-Platform-Paves-Way-for-Age-of-AI-Reasoning/default.aspx?utm_source=openai))
- Positioning: a performance/uplift iteration on Blackwell to better serve **test-time scaling / reasoning / agentic** workloads. ([investor.nvidia.com](https://investor.nvidia.com/news/press-release-details/2025/NVIDIA-Blackwell-Ultra-AI-Factory-Platform-Paves-Way-for-Age-of-AI-Reasoning/default.aspx?utm_source=openai))

### 4) **Rubin (Vera + Rubin GPU, NVLink 6) — next major platform in 2H 2026**
- This is the next full platform step (not just a GPU), anchored by:
  - **Vera CPU** (custom “Olympus” Arm-compatible cores)
  - **Rubin GPU** (called out by NVIDIA as using **HBM4**)
  - **NVLink 6** scale-up fabric (3.6 TB/s per GPU class bandwidth figure is part of NVIDIA’s Rubin disclosures) ([developer.nvidia.com](https://developer.nvidia.com/blog/inside-the-nvidia-rubin-platform-six-new-chips-one-ai-supercomputer/))
- System SKUs NVIDIA has named:
  - **Vera Rubin NVL72** rack-scale solution
  - **HGX Rubin NVL8** (enterprise server platform) ([investor.nvidia.com](https://investor.nvidia.com/news/press-release-details/2026/NVIDIA-Kicks-Off-the-Next-Generation-of-AI-With-Rubin--Six-New-Chips-One-Incredible-AI-Supercomputer/default.aspx?utm_source=openai))
- Timing: NVIDIA says Rubin is **in full production** and that **Rubin-based products will be available from partners in the second half of 2026**. ([investor.nvidia.com](https://investor.nvidia.com/news/press-release-details/2026/NVIDIA-Kicks-Off-the-Next-Generation-of-AI-With-Rubin--Six-New-Chips-One-Incredible-AI-Supercomputer/default.aspx?utm_source=openai))

### 5) **Rubin Ultra — planned for 2H 2027**
- NVIDIA has publicly messaged a follow-on **Rubin Ultra** step coming in **the second half of 2027**. ([apnews.com](https://apnews.com/article/457e9260aa2a34c1bbcc07c98b7a0555?utm_source=openai))

### 6) **Feynman — next architecture after Rubin Ultra (roadmapped to 2028)**
- NVIDIA has also shown **Feynman** as the subsequent datacenter architecture on its longer-range roadmap, targeted for **2028**. ([theverge.com](https://www.theverge.com/news/631835/nvidia-blackwell-ultra-ai-chip-gb300?utm_source=openai))

If you tell me whether you care more about **(a) enterprise HGX boards** vs **(b) rack-scale NVL systems** (NVL72/NVL144-class), I can reformat this into the specific SKU progression you’re likely tracking (HGX: B200 → B300 → Rubin; Rack-scale: GB200 NVL72 → GB300 NVL72 → Vera Rubin NVL72 → Rubin Ultra-class racks).
